title: Understanding the Buyer
learning_objectives: Identify key stakeholder roles in a typical enterprise laboratory environment.
Learn how to tailor Scifeon’s message to each stakeholder type.
Understand how enterprise buyers evaluate credibility and technical fit.
content:
Enterprise buying is multi-stakeholder. No single person decides. Each persona—QA Manager, IT Lead, Lab Director, Procurement Officer—views Scifeon from a different angle. Successful sales communication aligns with their concerns: QA wants validation traceability, IT needs data integrity and integration, Procurement demands predictable cost of ownership.

Scifeon sales engagements must therefore map and document the buyer structure early. The buyer’s internal project maturity determines both sales speed and negotiation position. Always prepare a stakeholder matrix with their roles, interests, and risks addressed explicitly in your presentation or proposal.

exercises.instruction: Create a 4-cell table linking stakeholder type to their top concern.
Review a previous demo or meeting and note which stakeholder concerns were not covered.

quiz.question: Which stakeholder is most concerned with 21 CFR Part 11 compliance?
Why should we document stakeholder mapping early?
options: To align messaging and reduce risk of miscommunication
quiz.answer: To align messaging and reduce risk of miscommunication
